page.title: 12 THE MORPETH GATHERING
page.content: The Morpeth Gathering has tightly packed into it a multitude of events and experiences.Candy-striped canvases hide beneath them a vast assortment of home made products from cinder toffee to apple chutney. Where the strains of Northumbrian pipes and fiddles are heard, clog and sword dancers appear to entertain onlookers. Energetic Morpethians may take part in hill races or in the{Cavalcade}on horseback, commemorating the return from the Battle of Otterburn. In the Town Hall young and old may marvel at the intricacies of{Corn {Dolly}making.Familiar scenes appear on glass,wood and canvas,all to be judged at the end of the week.Poetry and prose, written in Northumbrian dialect , is also judged.It,like the Gathering itself, is usually{"muckle bary !"}
